title: 21 Easter Basket Ideas: Sweet & Savory Goodies to Hide Around the House
description: If you're anything like me, the joy of Easter baskets doesn't stop when you outgrow the chocolate eggs. Sure, the toys and candy are fun, but what really makes an Easter basket feel extra special is curating the perfect assortment of goodies. Growing up, my mom’s Easter baskets were always thoughtfully filled with my favorite treats—from rich chocolate truffles to the most incredible homemade cookies—and even into my college years, she’d still keep the tradition alive (because who doesn’t love a basket filled with delicious surprises?). So, why not carry on this joyful tradition with your own take on an Easter basket? Whether you're putting together a basket for your food-loving friends or those who appreciate a touch of luxury, we’ve got you covered. From sweet confections to savory snacks and even something fun to sip, these 21 picks will elevate any Easter celebration. These are perfect for people who appreciate quality ingredients—think high-end chocolate bars, zesty sauces, and gourmet pantry staples. Read More >>
author: Julia Youman
excerpt: Delight your friends and family with a curated Easter basket filled with sweet treats, savory snacks, and fun sips.
text: If you're anything like me, the joy of Easter baskets doesn't stop when you outgrow the chocolate eggs. Sure, the toys and candy are fun, but what really makes an Easter basket feel extra special is curating the perfect assortment of goodies. Growing up, my mom’s Easter baskets were always thoughtfully filled with my favorite treats—from rich chocolate truffles to the most incredible homemade cookies—and even into my college years, she’d still keep the tradition alive (because who doesn’t love a basket filled with delicious surprises?). So, why not carry on this joyful tradition with your own take on an Easter basket? Whether you're putting together a basket for your food-loving friends or those who appreciate a touch of luxury, we’ve got you covered. From sweet confections to savory snacks and even something fun to sip, these 21 picks will elevate any Easter celebration. These are perfect for people who appreciate quality ingredients—think high-end chocolate bars, zesty sauces, and gourmet pantry staples. Ready to give a basket that’s as thoughtful as it is delicious? It's probably a little extra but it's fun! Check out our curated list of 21 sweet, savory, and sip-worthy ideas that will wow anyone this Easter. MAEVE chocolate medley A collection of artisanal chocolates that’ll wow anyone. Diaspora Co. Cinnamon A perfect gift for those who love to bake. Good-quality cinnamon is one of those things you wouldn’t buy yourself but would love to receive. Spring & mulberry chocolate bar A light, fruity chocolate bar that’s perfect for the season—I love this lavender rose flavor. It's probably one of the most beautiful chocolate bars I've seen. Trader Joe’s Milk Chocolate Bunny Bar A classic touch that never goes out of style. If you live near a Trader Joes, swing by to grab this chocolate bunny or their Easter Joe Joes. Date Better Gift Box Sample all of their flavors in one pack. We’ve been loving dates in the test kitchen as a sweet, unexpected treat and this brand has the cutest packaging. West~Bourne strawberry chili butter A sweet and spicy spread that adds a fun twist to any Easter breakfast. Gooey Butter Cookies Sweet, melt-in-your-mouth cookies with a nostalgic twist. These are great if you don’t feel like baking, but want to give the gift of homemade cookies. Fly by jing mini chili crunch sampler A spicy, crunchy treat that adds flavor to anything. Tari Hot Sauce For those who love adding heat to their dishes. Fishwife Tuna Sustainably sourced and perfect for a gourmet Easter snack. Their packaging is adorable and looks so cute in a gift basket. Plus, they just entered Costcos around the country! Maldon Garlic Sea Salt A kitchen essential that brings an elevated flavor to any meal. I love Maldon and chances are if your friends are frequent cooks, they already have their classic flaky sea salt so surprise them with a different flavor. Filthy Blue Cheese Olives A tangy, savory bite for the ultimate snack lover or dirty martini-obsessive. Sfoglini Calabrian Chili Pasta Artisan pasta with a zesty kick. I love the idea of packing in a box of pasta—this one’s a fun shape and unexpected flavor. Mercado Famous Jamón Serranía A luxurious, melt-in-your-mouth ham for the discerning eater. Also a great pick for anyone who loves building charcuterie boards. Leisure hydration Keep things fresh with this hydrating, refreshing drink mix. Tost Rosé A sparkling, refreshing sip for those celebrating with bubbles. Plus, one of my favorite non-alcoholic wines I’ve tried this year. Cheeky Espresso Syrup For a caffeine boost in the most fun, cheeky way. I tried this syrup earlier this year and kept it in the back of my mind for the next time I was building a basket. It’s great in coffee, cocktails, or on top of ice cream. Ghia Salt + Lime Spritz A non-alcoholic option that brings zesty fun to any celebration. Also one of my favorite NA options as it’s not too sweet. Tip Top Canned Cosmopolitan A ready-to-go cocktail for easy Easter sipping. I love their branding and this cosmo is the perfect spring vibe. Flouwer Co. Garnishing Set Okay, not a sipper, but perfect for the friend who loves to make their cocktails as beautiful as they are delicious. It also looks great sprinkled on frosted cakes and cookies. Straightaway Bees Knees One of my favorite cocktails (especially for spring) and this one’s pre-made. Tuck one in a basket and keep one for yourself. Looking to make your Easter celebrations even more special? These 21 Easter basket ideas bring together the best of sweet, savory, and sip-worthy gifts that are perfect for anyone who appreciates a thoughtful, high-quality gift. Whether you’re curating a basket for a family member, a friend, or even for yourself, these picks are sure to delight and add that extra touch of joy to your holiday. Are you someone who loves an Easter basket? If so, what are your go-to goodies?
html:
If you're anything like me, the joy of Easter baskets doesn't stop when you outgrow the chocolate eggs. Sure, the toys and candy are fun, but what really makes an Easter basket feel extra special is curating the perfect assortment of goodies. Growing up, my mom’s Easter baskets were always thoughtfully filled with my favorite treats—from rich chocolate truffles to the most incredible homemade cookies—and even into my college years, she’d still keep the tradition alive (because who doesn’t love a basket filled with delicious surprises?).

So, why not carry on this joyful tradition with your own take on an Easter basket? Whether you're putting together a basket for your food-loving friends or those who appreciate a touch of luxury, we’ve got you covered. From sweet confections to savory snacks and even something fun to sip, these 21 picks will elevate any Easter celebration. These are perfect for people who appreciate quality ingredients—think high-end chocolate bars, zesty sauces, and gourmet pantry staples.

Ready to give a basket that’s as thoughtful as it is delicious? It's probably a little extra but it's fun! Check out our curated list of 21 sweet, savory, and sip-worthy ideas that will wow anyone this Easter.

MAEVE chocolate medley

A collection of artisanal chocolates that’ll wow anyone.

Diaspora Co. Cinnamon

A perfect gift for those who love to bake. Good-quality cinnamon is one of those things you wouldn’t buy yourself but would love to receive.

Spring & mulberry chocolate bar

A light, fruity chocolate bar that’s perfect for the season—I love this lavender rose flavor. It's probably one of the most beautiful chocolate bars I've seen.

Trader Joe’s Milk Chocolate Bunny Bar

A classic touch that never goes out of style. If you live near a Trader Joes, swing by to grab this chocolate bunny or their Easter Joe Joes.

Date Better Gift Box

Sample all of their flavors in one pack. We’ve been loving dates in the test kitchen as a sweet, unexpected treat and this brand has the cutest packaging.

West~Bourne strawberry chili butter

A sweet and spicy spread that adds a fun twist to any Easter breakfast.

Gooey Butter Cookies

Sweet, melt-in-your-mouth cookies with a nostalgic twist. These are great if you don’t feel like baking, but want to give the gift of homemade cookies.

Fly by jing mini chili crunch sampler

A spicy, crunchy treat that adds flavor to anything.

Tari Hot Sauce

For those who love adding heat to their dishes.

Fishwife Tuna

Sustainably sourced and perfect for a gourmet Easter snack. Their packaging is adorable and looks so cute in a gift basket. Plus, they just entered Costcos around the country!

Maldon Garlic Sea Salt

A kitchen essential that brings an elevated flavor to any meal. I love Maldon and chances are if your friends are frequent cooks, they already have their classic flaky sea salt so surprise them with a different flavor.

Filthy Blue Cheese Olives

A tangy, savory bite for the ultimate snack lover or dirty martini-obsessive.

Sfoglini Calabrian Chili Pasta

Artisan pasta with a zesty kick. I love the idea of packing in a box of pasta—this one’s a fun shape and unexpected flavor.

Mercado Famous Jamón Serranía

A luxurious, melt-in-your-mouth ham for the discerning eater. Also a great pick for anyone who loves building charcuterie boards.

Leisure hydration

Keep things fresh with this hydrating, refreshing drink mix.

Tost Rosé

A sparkling, refreshing sip for those celebrating with bubbles. Plus, one of my favorite non-alcoholic wines I’ve tried this year.

Cheeky Espresso Syrup

For a caffeine boost in the most fun, cheeky way. I tried this syrup earlier this year and kept it in the back of my mind for the next time I was building a basket. It’s great in coffee, cocktails, or on top of ice cream.

Ghia Salt + Lime Spritz

A non-alcoholic option that brings zesty fun to any celebration. Also one of my favorite NA options as it’s not too sweet.

Tip Top Canned Cosmopolitan

A ready-to-go cocktail for easy Easter sipping. I love their branding and this cosmo is the perfect spring vibe.

Flouwer Co. Garnishing Set

Okay, not a sipper, but perfect for the friend who loves to make their cocktails as beautiful as they are delicious. It also looks great sprinkled on frosted cakes and cookies.

Straightaway Bees Knees

One of my favorite cocktails (especially for spring) and this one’s pre-made. Tuck one in a basket and keep one for yourself.

Looking to make your Easter celebrations even more special? These 21 Easter basket ideas bring together the best of sweet, savory, and sip-worthy gifts that are perfect for anyone who appreciates a thoughtful, high-quality gift. Whether you’re curating a basket for a family member, a friend, or even for yourself, these picks are sure to delight and add that extra touch of joy to your holiday.

Are you someone who loves an Easter basket? If so, what are your go-to goodies?
